description:
Rin Shima has left her hometown in Yamanashi to live on her own in Nagoya while working for a small publishing company there. On one winter’s weekend in the not-too-distant future, as she’s planning a bike tour, she unexpectedly receives a message from an old high school friend, Chiaki Oogaki, saying she’s currently in Nagoya. Chiaki now works for an organization promoting tourism in Yamanashi, and she’s in charge of a project to reopen a facility that was closed a few years ago. When Rin casually suggests that such a large property would make a good campground, Chiaki is inspired. She gathers up all of their old camping buddies— Nadeshiko Kagamihara, who works at an outdoor goods store in Tokyo; Aoi Inuyama, who’s now an elementary school teacher in their hometown of Yamanashi; and Ena Saitou, who works at a dog grooming salon in Yokohama—and the campground-opening project is set in motion. So the story of five outdoorsy girls who became friends thanks to their shared love of camping begins once more, taking on a new challenge with the knowledge and experience they’ve gained.

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Camping
tags.description: Features the recreational activity of camping, either in a tent, vehicle, or simply sleeping outdoors.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

alternative: リンの祖父 (Rin no Sofu; Rin's Grandfather)

node.description:
__[Website](https://erisasaki.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eri_lattice)__

__Eri Sasaki__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer, who is signed to 5pb. Records and Sony Music Publishing. She made her music debut in 2015 with the release of her first single "Ring of Fortune", which is used as the opening theme to the anime television series Plastic Memories. She released her first album in 2017.

(Source: [Eri Sasaki's Official Website](https://erisasaki.net/profile), edited)

__[Website](http://asaka1007.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakaofficial)__

__Birthplace:__ Aichi Prefecture, Japan
__Hobbies & Special Skills:__ Watching Anime, Karaoke, Cosplay, Sleeping, English

__Asaka__ is a Japanese vocalist and translator.
Noriko Tsutsumiya is an animator who primarily does work for C-Station.

[Website](https://highkick.jp/tateyama)

He is a drummer for the Japanese rock band THE LINDA!, which was formed in 2002 when its members were enrolled at Rikkyo University.
